answers.answer: try to have blood chemistry test
Thanks Ronald,What type of blood test is the blood chemistry test. I am new to all of this. Tomorrow I go for a diabetes test.I live in Australia are our test different here?

hi helga,we have almost the same situation, last january i was diagnosed with a high liver enzyme in a clinic.It was my first time to hear that so i decided to seek another test in a good hospital,with my doctor request i had undergone with blood chemistry (im not sure if we have the same reference of basis),and the results showed of high ALT,AST,Ferritin,uricFrom this my doctor required me to have upper abdomen ultrasound.The result is a mild fatty liver.Since i have a high ferritin level i need to go further test which ended in a liver biopsy,which was finally concluded that i have a severe fatty liver with fibrosis but with minimal level of iron.At the moment i am experiencing once i a while pain in my upper right abdomen but doctor says it is the fatty liver that causes it.Actually i am pretty worried of my iron level because of feeling of fatigue,joint pain.I am planning to see a liver specialist doctor here in Manila to seek for more advise.

question: I have been diagnosed with extremely high iron levels and have been tested for hemochromatosis which was negative but now my sugar levels are high along with my choleterol. I have previously had heart problems and this weekend I have developed pain in my upper right quadrant just under my ribs and when i bend over it is like something is in the way.I have had my gall bladder removed years ago.Could all the above symptons be related? What is causing the new pain?
title: Too much iron
